subject: [junit] Dynamically generated Test ??
msgSnippet: Is there a way to dynamically generate tests? For example instead of: public void test1(int value){ assertEquals(0, value); } public void test2(int value){
messageBody:
Is there a way to dynamically generate tests?

For example instead of:

public void test1(int value){ assertEquals(0, value);
}
public void test2(int value){ assertEquals(0, value);
}
.
.
.
public void testN(int value){ assertEquals(0, value);
}


lets say I dont know how many tests I am going to need
yet, but I AM going to receive an array whose length
is the number of tests I will need. Is there someway
to:

for (int i; i < myArray.length; i++)
//create new test (myArray[i]);


but STILL have a different test for each item in the
array.

TIA,
/mario
